- 6 -
"1. Draw up a national plan for the comprehensive
development of educational television.
”2. Prepare detailed budget proposals for large-scale
public and private financing.
”3. Establish general timetables for the build-up of
open-circuit and closed-circuit systems, plus tape-and-fllm libraries.
”4. Seek to enlist the wholehearted support of the
Department of Health, Education and Welfare, the Foundations, and
other interested principals.
”5. Mount a massive informational campaign to persuade
every American that failure to support this effort will mean the
forfeiture of our childrens educational heritage.”
